content.description:
Start with one foot on the little ledge on the far right side of the main boulder. Your left hand goes into a push on a small rail and your right jams into the crack above your foot. Reach for a juggy hold on the small alcove with your left hand, match, then swap feet, and get your left foot situated comfortably in the alcove. Reach for a pretty bad slopey crimp with your right hand, and stand on your left foot. Match, then go for a big reach to the solid 3-finger pocket. Swap feet, get your right hand on the little 2-finger pocket/pinch, then move around the lump blocking the left side of the boulder until you can grab a jug at the top of

Crumble Crack

, and top out.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter. The reach move is sketchy, and the fall isn't nice either.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Crumble Crack

.

content.description: Start with your left foot in the little divot and your right foot either jammed into the crack or flagged. Your left hand will be jammed below your right, holding a pretty juggy edge, and your right will be further up the crack. Get your right hand into the jug above your left, then shift your right foot up. Keep shifting your left hand until you can get your left foot comfortably out of the starting foothold, then flag it, and get your right up to a solid spot. Move your right hand into a jam in the top section of the crack, reach for the jug at the top, and top out.
content.protection: A pad, and a spotter would be nice, but the landing won't be horrible if you can control it.
content.location: It is the obvious line on the boulder.
